title: مركز الإبداع
description: الأسئلة الموقفية في إدارة المشاريع الاحترافية

test.text: During the execution phase of your project, a Resource Manager informed you that one of the experts allocated to your project had to be motivated in order to perform very well.nnWhat would be the recommended actions to address this issue?

choices.text: Remind the functional manager that is his duty to motivate his team
Remind the team member that there are penalties for bad behaviours.
Remind the team member that there are financial incentives for the team.
Remind the team member their important role and how it will be rewarded.

test.text: During project execution, a team member made a mistake resulting in a 1-week delay to the project schedule. What should the project manager do with regard to this error and delay?

choices.text: Discuss the issue with the team, look for solutions, and offer to help and support the team.
Make sure the impact of this mistake is understood by the team member who made the mistake.
Escalate the issue to senior management to make sure a similar mistake won't happen again.
Find a solution, communicate it to the team, and reinforce that it should be implemented now.

test.text: A project manager is involved in an e-commerce development project. The project has been completed successfully using the hybrid model and initiated operations handover. The project manager notices that the development team is relaxed and not spending time on the handover process, which is impacting application support.nnHow should the project manager handle this situation?

choices.text: Confront the development team and demand their immediate attention to the handover process.
Meet with the development team to discuss the importance of the handover process and its impact on application support.
Delegate the responsibility of the handover process to another team member to ensure it gets done properly.
Disregard the issue and expect that the development team will address and resolve the issue on their own.

test.text: A project manager is managing an agile project. In order to make sure there is enough funding available for the project, the project sponsor is asking the project manager for an estimate when the project will be completed.nnHow should the project manager respond to the sponsor?

choices.text: Inform the sponsor that an estimate is not necessary, as agile supports responding to change over following a plan.
Remind the sponsor that agile projects are not judged based on budget and schedule.
Provide the estimate to the sponsor, as agile supports estimating.
Influence the sponsor to add a contingency buffer to the cost in case of a cost overrun.

test.text: A project manager is managing a project that has a component using agile. The project sponsor asks the project manager to add a new component to this project which is government regulated with new complex tax-rules with enough time provided to implement these rules. The sponsor suggests implementing this new component using predictive non-agile approach due to its complexity.nnWhich methodology will the project manager use for this new component?

choices.text: Inform the project sponsor that you will manage the new component using agile methodology as agile supports one-size-fits-all.
Use hybrid approach by continuing to manage the existing component using agile, and the new component using predictive.
Manage the existing component as well as the new component using predictive plan-based approach.
Seek guidance from project sponsor for which methodology will suit best for new component.

test.text: A project manager is handling virtual teams around the world. What should the project manager do to overcome cross-cultural differences?

choices.text: Create grapevine communication channels and invite team members to contribute freely
Nurture stronger personal boundaries and individual sovereignty
Create an environment where team members can openly communicate
Create a shared understanding of team goals and objectives

test.text: For virtual teams, the following are the boundaries that teams need to work through for successful project outcomes, except:

choices.text: Interpersonal interactions and developing relational capital
Working practices and routines
Knowledge diversity
Personal Convenience

test.text: Engagement and motivation can be successfully achieved by the project manager in a virtual team by all the following, except:

choices.text: Goal Setting
Task Structures
Inefficient Collaboration
Reward Systems

test.text: Good communication etiquettes of a Project Manager include the following when sending emails, except:

choices.text: Always responding immediately to emotional messages
Knowing your audience
Always being courteous
Using proper grammar, spelling, and punctuation

test.text: Project managers should wear a leadership face and drive the project team to achieve the expected deliverables. What qualities should a project manager have? (Choose 3).

choices.text: Lead
Ethical
Adapt
Aggressive
Empower

test.text: A project manager is on a project that has a significant dependence on market changes. The PMO recommended to use an agile approach and the project manager scheduled reference checks to select the implementation partner. To be successful, agile needs a high level of trust between the client and vendor.nnWhich of the following aspects should the project manager look for to build trust that the vendor can deliver? (Choose 2).

choices.text: Processes and tools - to ensure that the vendor used an efficient and repeatable delivery approach
Technical excellence - to ensure that the deliverables were completed as soon as possible and of a high quality
Perseverance - to ensure that the vendor overcome the challenges inherent to frequent scope change
Planning skills - to ensure that the vendor met the costs and milestones agreed in the contract

test.text: A project being run by a project manager is implementing a new technology. The project manager wants to be sure that the project delivers business value.nnWhat roles are critical in ensuring that the organization will benefit from the project delivery? (Choose 3).

choices.text: People and culture manager
Project manager
Business analyst
Customer lead
Technical architect

test.text: A project manager is leading a project that entails transitioning to agile. The project will pilot the agile delivery modeled around using four resources from a vendor, working alongside two internal resources with no agile experience. The project manager needs to act as a coach for the project team and help them understand the differences between the functioning of a traditional project team and an agile team.nnWhat is the most important thing the project manager needs to do to establish agile team behavior?

choices.text: Focus on the produced result of the team.
Build trust within the team.
Encourage collaboration among the team.
Hold each team member accountable.

test.text: A project team recently completed a long-term project using a predictive approach. The team then started a new project with the same project manager, but now they are using an agile approach. After the initial sprint, the team waits for the project manager to make decisions on behalf of the team, as has been done in previous projects.nnWhat should the project manager do?

choices.text: Ask the product owner to make decisions for the team.
Give continuous positive feedback to all team members.
Remind the team that they are using an agile approach.
Coach the team to guide and support their own decisions.

test.text: During a retrospective meeting, the project team confirmed that all deliverables were completed according to the specifications provided in the product backlog. However, the number of errors found during testing increased dramatically.nnWhat should the project manager do?

choices.text: Meet with quality assurance specialists to clarify the issue and seek resolutions.
Review the risk management plan to determine the mitigation strategy.
Perform a Monte Carlo analysis to identify possible scenarios and actions.
Register the risk in the risk register and monitor it during the next iteration.

test.text: An application developer took a story card to work that read "Customer can pay using credit card". After the implementation, the functionality was rejected because the application could not accept foreign credit cards.nnWhat should the project manager have done to avoid this issue?

choices.text: Described the user story in more detail.
Scheduled the user story for the next iteration.
Performed iterative backlog grooming with the team.
Gathered more detailed requirement specifications from end users.

test.text: The sponsor notified the product owner that the budget was approved for a project. However, any additional investment for the project would have to wait until the next fiscal year. The product owner is concerned that this will hold up the project.nnWhat should the product owner do?

choices.text: Track the budget based on the release plan and show the value to the business.
Explain that the project is just starting and the budget will need to be adjusted.
Track the budget based on each sprint and remove nice-to-have deliverables.
Ensure that the project manager monitors every invoice from the project.

test.text: During release planning, a conflict arises between stakeholders regarding prioritizing certain needs, which is causing the development team to lose focus. To align all stakeholders and resolve this conflict, which conflict resolution technique should the project manager employ?

choices.text: Forcing
Collaboration
Withdrawal
Smoothing

test.text: A project team has been tasked to build a new product. The team builds the demo first and add features to the initial product. This is an example of what technical practice?

choices.text: Test-Driven Development (TDD)
Continuous Delivery
Behavior-Driven Development
Spikes

test.text: A company's project management office (PMO) is incorporating more adaptive technologies and has hired a new project manager with hybrid project management experience. The team is slow in adopting the new methodology and has not been updating project artifacts in a timely manner.nnWhich action should the project manager take to improve the team's performance?

choices.text: Send an email asking all project team members to complete updates at the end of the day.
Set up a training session for all project team members.
Reach out to the functional managers for support.
Speak individually with each project team member about making the needed updates.

test.text: An agile team has been struggling to keep up with the planned pace, which is frequently resulting in sprint failures. What should the project manager do to help avoid this situation in the future?

choices.text: Ask the project sponsor to approve overtime to compensate for the lack of performance while adjusting the plan.
Review the velocity of the team over the last several sprints and adjust the plan accordingly.
Replace junior team members with more experienced ones, and negotiate the project scope to compensate for the budget gap.
Switch to a Kanban approach to have better control on the planned pace by limiting work in progress.

test.text: A project manager is struggling to figure out the performance of the project teams in an agile environment. For the same scope of work, team A has calculated and delivered 100 story points and team B has calculated and delivered 125 story points.nnWhich team is performing better?

choices.text: Team A as they have calculated fewer story points than team B.
Team B as they have calculated more story points than team A.
The team that completes the most stories selected from the sprint backlog.
The team with the least amount of defects in their deliverables.

test.text: A company has an existing contract to maintain and enhance a client's customer database. The company's legal department informs the project manager that a new piece of legislation requiring stricter protection of customer information might soon be signed into law. The law will require additional security features to be implemented into the database the project manager is maintaining. These features are not included in the scope of the current contract.nnWhat should the project manager do?

choices.text: Seek the project sponsor's support to influence the client to amend the contract immediately.
Ask the legal department to raise the issue in the next contract negotiation with the customer.
Update the risk register with the issue and plan risk response with the project sponsor and client.
Wait until the legal requirements are finalized so the change in scope can be concretely defined.

test.text: An experienced project manager is managing a multi-million dollar agile project. The project manager communicates the ground rules to the team, but after 12 iterations, the project manager starts noticing that some team members are not following the ground rules.nnWhat should the project manager do first to ensure team adherence to the ground rules?

choices.text: Contact human resources to request a written warning letter be sent to team members not following the ground rules.
Ask the functional manager to replace team members not following the ground rules.
Schedule a meeting with the project team to reinforce the ground rules.
Notify the project sponsor about this behavior and ask the sponsor to take disciplinary action.

test.text: The steering committee has asked a project manager experienced in agile to provide an indication of the time remaining on a medium-sized project. What tools can be used to provide this information?

choices.text: Analysis of the business requirements document
A release burndown chart
Story points for the remaining user stories
Surrogate measurements

test.text: A newly formed team has become accustomed to agile practices. The project lead has noticed that while they are performing according to expectations, there is boredom with daily team practices among many of the team members.nnWhat should the project lead do in this situation?

choices.text: Allow the team to self-organize and have them analyze the situation in their retrospective session and self correct.
Challenge the team to find new ways to achieve higher levels of performance to improve the situation.
Speak with individual team members to determine what they would like to do to improve the situation in the team.
Have the team inform senior management of the situation and ask for recommendations.

test.text: A project manager is working with a Scrum team that is continually missing deadlines. The steering committee is concerned about the project as it is not clear that it will deliver the expected value. After some analysis, the project manager discovers there is a mismatch of competencies in one of the teams.nnWhat should the project manager do?

choices.text: Accept the risk of the project missing deadlines due to the mismatch.
Provide appropriate training to compensate for the mismatch.
Update the project schedule to reflect the delay.
Emphasize to the teams the importance of meeting the agreed deadlines.

test.text: A large corporation is transforming itself from a predictive to agile approach. A project team with knowledge of agile practices is experiencing significant conflicts with the executives regarding the processes to be followed.nnHow should these conflicts be resolved?

choices.text: Negotiate with the executives and agree on a process.
Train the executives on agile practices.
Include the executives in team retrospectives.
Request that the executives use agile practices.

test.text: A team member is hosting an event and invites several colleagues through their work calendars. Another team member, who was not invited to the event, is noticeably distracted during several standup meetings.nnWhat should the project manager do?

choices.text: Ask the individual who is hosting the event to mark it as private.
Set up a meeting with the distracted team member to discuss any issues.
Ask the individual who is hosting the event to use private communication methods.
Add a social events section to the charter to handle these situations.

test.text: A project manager is managing a hybrid project. A stakeholder has directly contacted a team member and has requested a change. Due to the request, the team member was distracted from their work, which caused a loss in productivity.nnWhat should the team member do?

choices.text: Inform the stakeholder that the correct procedure for new requirements is to provide it directly to the project manager.
Inform the stakeholder that the correct procedure for new requirements is to provide it directly to the change control board (CCB).
Inform the scrum master regarding the stakeholder's request for a change and the impact this has had on productivity.
Inform the scrum master so that the change can be discussed directly with the stakeholder.

test.text: In an industrial plant, the owner has decided to add more capacity to the plant by installing a new machine and updating the software used in production. This capacity enlargement will occur while the plant is still functioning and producing. The software update will be accomplished using an agile approach in order to minimize risk. The machine procurement, installation, and integration will be accomplished using predictive approaches.nnWhat types of communications will the project manager have to design into the schedule management plan to ensure the project will be on schedule?

choices.text: Weekly colocated meetings with the relevant stakeholders
Biweekly written status reports from the relevant stakeholders
Weekly one-on-one meetings with each of the relevant stakeholders
Biweekly conference calls with the relevant stakeholders

test.text: An agile project is running its fifth iteration out of 10. After the last retrospective, the team members realize that they had to work extra hours to deliver the committed work.nnWhat should the project manager do?

choices.text: Ask the team to have a lower commitment for the next iteration.
Ask for additional team members to maintain the velocity.
Conduct a focused retrospective to help the team to discover the root cause.
Implement a checkpoint in the iteration to verify if the team is on track.

test.text: A project is being executed. The project's life cycle is defined as predictive; however, a major deliverable will be handed over incrementally to the customer. The assigned resources are experienced and reliable and are willing to make decisions that the project manager used to make after each incremental delivery on other projects.nnWhat should the project manager do?

choices.text: Inform the team that although this is a hybrid environment, the project manager must still be responsible for making decisions.
Consult the product owner about letting the resources make decisions.
Support the decisions of the team and transfer the decision making responsibility to them.
Schedule a steering committee meeting and obtain their approval on the request.

test.text: A team has been working for two months and has consistently missed planned user stories. How should the project manager address this issue?

choices.text: Promote changing the iteration duration in order to commit as planned.
Ensure the sprint size is appropriate for the iteration duration.
Engage in recruiting a highly skilled resource to reinforce the skills.
Consider using a reward system to encourage timely delivery.

test.text: A project manager is managing a project with a hybrid approach and has requested a senior team member to perform a quantitative risk analysis. The team member responds that they do not have the knowledge to perform such an analysis.nnWhat should the project manager do?

choices.text: Escalate the issue to the functional manager.
Contact the project management office (PMO) and request them to assign another team member who has the knowledge to perform this task to the team.
Help the team member to perform the quantitative risk analysis through coaching, mentoring, and training.
Perform the quantitative risk analysis for the team member.

test.text: A transportation company is transforming its operational processes and the main system this company uses to move freight. The scope statement is in place. An iterative delivery approach has been agreed by all stakeholders.nnWhat does the project manager need to do next to help the team understand the work that needs to be done?

choices.text: Start working on the project management plan with work packages, a detailed schedule, and work assignments for team members.
Work directly with stakeholders on the work breakdown structure (WBS) and assign tasks with a required timeline for each team member to start the work.
Work with the team to decompose the scope into a WBS and work packages in order to create required deliverables and timelines.
Create the requirements management plan to outline how project requirements will be collected, analyzed, and documented, and then assign requirements to team members.

test.text: A lengthy, ongoing project exhausts a project team. Due to deadline issues, the project manager cannot extend the project schedule.nnWhat should the project manager do next?

choices.text: Review the project charter.
Provide more recognition to team members.
Discuss the situation with the team.
Request additional resources.

test.text: Due to a recent incident, a dissatisfied stakeholder files a complaint about a project that has been closed. What can the project manager do to help resolve this?

choices.text: Execute the relationship management plan.
Consult with the project sponsor to manage the dissatisfied stakeholder.
Review the project management information system (PMIS) archives.
Update the risk register.

test.text: During a project steering committee meeting, the project manager reports that a formerly supportive key team member has become resistant to and negative about changes. Where should this information be captured?

choices.text: Responsible, accountable, consult, and inform (RACI) matrix
Stakeholders engagement assessment matrix
Risk register and issue log
Work performance reports

test.text: A team receives outsourced deliverables and determines that they do not meet the agreed-upon acceptance criteria. What should the project manager reference to verify this with the vendor?

choices.text: Procurement management plan
Request for proposal (RFP)
Statement of work (SOW)
Inspections

test.text: A project manager in a cross-functional organization needs to inform the department manager of the number and type of resources required, and the length of time they will be needed. What should the project manager use to present this resource information?

choices.text: Resource assignments
Resource histogram
Responsibility assignment matrix (RAM)
Project organization chart

test.text: A demanding project stakeholder insists that an additional feature be added to a project product without changing the scope, budget, or schedule. The project manager allows this feature to be included since it adds great value to the end product. However, the project manager discovers that adding this feature has lengthened the project schedule and increased project costs.n	Which process should the project manager have followed before including the additional product feature?

choices.text: Change control
Schedule planning
Procurement planning
Quality audit

test.text: A project to create a new product is completed and introduced into the market, but sales are much lower than expected. Analysis determines that the product is misaligned with the organization's core competencies.nnDuring what activity should this have been discovered?

choices.text: What-if scenario analysis
Business case review
Strategic performance evaluation
Scope definition

test.text: A project is being audited to ensure compliance with organizational policies. What process is being conducted?

choices.text: Audit Schedule
Plan Quality Management
Control Quality
Manage Quality

test.text: While working on a project, the project team realizes that recent data center upgrades could impact the project's outcome. Certain modules of the project deliverable are incompatible with the new environment. The team identifies the appropriate steps to address the issue.nnWhat is the next step for the project manager?

choices.text: Request a budget increase.
Submit a change request.
Change the project schedule.
Update the requirements document.

test.text: A customer's requested design change is approved by the change control board (CCB). The project manager then discovers that the change will cause a three-month project delay.nnWhat should the project manager have done to avoid this?

choices.text: Increased the authorized budget, and requested additional resources
Redefined the project scope to include the new design
Fast tracked and crashed the schedule
Thoroughly assessed the request in accordance with the risk management plan

test.text: A new warehouse facility is under construction. The project manager implements team development efforts such as training that will result in a lower defect ratio.nnWhat should the project manager do next?

choices.text: Introduce a training program.
Update the resource management plan.
Increase quality control reviews.
Add training costs to the budget.

test.text: A company is using Lean Six Sigma methodology on a project. Midway through the project, an external Lean consultant is invited to conduct an audit to ensure that the methodology is being properly applied.nnWhich process is being employed?

choices.text: Manage Quality
Control Quality
Perform Qualitative Risk Analysis
Plan Quality Management

test.text: An experienced project manager is preparing a kick-off meeting for a new service assessment. A high-level description of the service has been provided.nnWhat should the project manager do first?

choices.text: Develop the project charter.
Develop the responsible, accountable, consult, and inform (RACI) matrix.
Define the project scope statement.
Create the work breakdown structure (WBS).

test.text: During a project's initiation phase, the project manager reviews the business case and finds that information is incomplete. What should the project manager do?

choices.text: Add an information gap to the risk register.
Review the project statement of work (SOW) to create the project charter.
Revise the business case to narrow the project scope and create the project charter.
Review the business case with the sponsoring organization to confirm that the project aligns with business needs.

test.text: During project implementation, an issue arises that requires the execution of the project's contingency plan, which will impact the project schedule. What should the project manager do?

choices.text: Initiate a risk audit.
Issue a change request.
Review the cost impact.
Update the contingency plan.

test.text: A project manager discovers a significant flaw in a major project deliverable. Which project management process is being performed?

choices.text: Manage Quality
Control Quality
Plan Quality Management
Statistical Sampling

test.text: While preparing a project charter for a new project, a project manager reviews lessons learned from previous projects. The lessons learned documents show frequent issues with low engagement levels and stakeholder misalignment on project objectives.nnWhat should the project manager do to avoid repetition of this issue in the new project?

choices.text: Allow any stakeholder to join the change control board (CCB) at any time in the project.
Include all stakeholders in the responsibility assignment matrix (RAM) for acceptance of the deliverables.
Gather all the requirements provided by every individual stakeholder and include in the work breakdown structure (WBS).
Build a common understanding among stakeholders about key deliverables described in the approved project charter.

test.text: A new project has high uncertainty in the cost required for completion. What approach should the project manager use to determine the expected costs?

choices.text: Analogous estimating
Statistical techniques estimating
Parametric estimating
Three-point estimating

test.text: All quality controls have passed, and a project deliverable is ready to be released to the customer. However, a change request to add new quality criteria has been approved.nnWhat should the project manager do first?

choices.text: Update the project management plan.
Stop the release of the deliverable to the customer.
Use the new quality criteria for future deliverables.
Update the risk register.

test.text: During a group activity to identify an input to the Plan Procurement Management process, some participants disagree with the ranking of compliance-related items. What tool or technique should the project manager use to resolve this?

choices.text: Affinity diagram
Multicriteria decision analysis
Nominal group technique
Brainstorming

test.text: A multinational company is locally developing a digital product using a new technology platform. The only expert on this platform is located in the company's headquarters, and they are responsible for providing support to different countries.nnHow can the local project manager ensure the involvement of this expert?

choices.text: Design a travel schedule so that timely, onsite assistance can be provided.
Include the expert on the team using a virtual environment.
Ask the project sponsor to assign the expert as a full-time member of the team.
Ask team members to contact the expert as an external expertise source on an as-needed basis.

test.text: During project closure, the project manager finds it difficult to obtain successful project completion feedback. Some stakeholders disagree with the project's success criteria and have been frustrated with the project from the beginning.nnTo what should the project manager refer to address these concerns?

choices.text: Project charter
Quality management plan
Scope statement
Requirements documentation

test.text: An impact assessment reveals that a deliverable could be delayed by two weeks. A key resource has not been available to work on a non-critical activity due to other priorities. This could cause work overload on the other remaining resources.nnSince cost is a major constraint for this project, what should the project manager do immediately?

choices.text: Determine if the task has available float to meet the project end date.
Hire a temporary resource to do the job.
Consult the team and reduce the scope.
Change the resource calendar to avoid major delays.

test.text: An approved project charter stated that an agile approach must be used. During a lessons learned session, the client indicates that the team was unable to provide reliable cost estimates for the project, and that more time should be allocated to define the scope during the first iteration.nnWhat lesson should be captured in the lessons learned repository?

choices.text: The client should be exposed to the agile approach in advance to understand the cost estimating process.
The agile approach should not be used if the client requires reliable cost estimates.
During the first iteration of a project, time should be allocated to define the scope and ensure that reliable cost estimates are performed.
Client communications should be included in the daily standups.

test.text: A senior manager informs a project manager that the project is not performing as well as other projects. What can the project manager use to improve performance for the next series of iterations?

choices.text: Retrospective session
Backlog analysis
Team building
Team motivation

test.text: A company is kicking off a new hybrid project to be in compliance with new government regulations. The team has established a reliable velocity of 40 story points per iteration. Every iteration lasts 2 weeks. The sponsor wants to know when the project will be done if there are 800 story points remaining.

choices.text: 4 hours
8 weeks
40 days
10 months

test.text: A project manager is on a mega industrial project. The project team is distributed throughout six different countries and time zones. During a review meeting, it was noticed that important baselined milestone dates were missed.nnWhat is the most likely reason for the missed deadlines?

choices.text: Lack of buy-in commitment
Poor team communication
Misunderstanding stakeholder expectations
Stakeholders' expectation is set too high

test.text: A project manager was just given a new project to handle. She is working on the project documents and, after reading the Project Charter, is compiling the risks as she sees them. Once she completes the list, when should it be reviewed?

choices.text: When starting the project and as each risk is closed.
While organizing, preparing, and carrying out the work.
During weekly meetings as new risks are identified and added.
Regularly and throughout the project.

test.text: In an agile development environment, when should a risk analysis be performed?

choices.text: Before the start of each iteration
During the daily standup meeting
In the retrospective meeting
After every scrum meeting

test.text: A project manager has noticed apparent interpersonal conflict between some team members during the initiation of a project. When should the project manager address this problem?

choices.text: At the earliest time possible to prevent the conflict from escalating later in the project
Prior to every meeting by reminding the project team to be respectful with each other
Directly after an outburst or dispute between members to determine which member is right
At the end of the project to let the conflict de-escalate and record it in the lessons learned

test.text: A newly-hired project manager is running a project for the first time and is worried about rising tensions. Project team members are arguing during an effort-intensive phase and stakeholders have voiced some doubts about the project's performance. In a discussion with a senior project manager, the new project manager admits that they have a fear of conflict and asks the senior project manager how they perceive conflict.nnHow should the senior project manager respond?

choices.text: Conflict in projects is inevitable - focus on managing it.
Conflict in projects is preventable - replan the mitigation.
Conflict in projects is disastrous - prepare a recovery plan.
Conflict in projects is healthy - refrain from interfering.

test.text: A team is working on a complex and fast-changing new product development project. After a recent process evaluation, the team decides to add an agile toolkit to the predictive approach they are using. This addition is intended to improve the overall project delivery, success, and productivity.nnWhich of the following describes how this change is intended to add value to the overall delivery, success, and productivity?

choices.text: Use the agile toolkit to leverage the ability of agile methods to respond effectively to change, while maintaining the benefits of a predictive approach to project management.
Use the agile toolkit to replace all predictive methods with new agile methods, and by doing so, reduce poor productivity.
Use the agile toolkit to compare agile against predictive methods, then choose the best approach for future projects.
Use the agile toolkit and ask team members to choose between agile and predictive methods so that they will work more effectively and productively.

test.text: A project manager engaged in the delivery of a global project is in the process of recruiting a project team. After the team is formed, what should the project manager do?

choices.text: Send a welcome email and host a team introductory event with the team members so they get to know each other.
Send a project management plan and charter to team members to familiarize them with project goals and procedures.
Arrange a meeting for team members to discuss any concerns regarding requirements and project scope.
Send the team members a survey to learn more about each member, share the results via email.

test.text: At which stage in the Tuckman team development model should the project manager put the most focus on increasing team motivation?

choices.text: Forming
Storming
Norming
Performing

test.text: An executive stakeholder has crucial decision power on the execution and success of a project. How should this stakeholder's importance be reflected in the stakeholder engagement plan?

choices.text: Describe the executive's support level, expectations, risk threshold, and appropriate communications for various project needs.
Rank the executive in an organizational chart and illustrate any affinities or hostilities with other stakeholders.
Label the executive as "supportive" and ensure that email, phone numbers, and absence/vacation times are up to date.
Describe the executive's involvement in similar past projects in order to decide the appropriate engagement level on a case-by-case basis.

test.text: A new graduate recently joined a mature agile R&D team. A mentor, assigned to work with the graduate, is overwhelmed by the extra workload. Team performance and motivation are dropping.nnHow can the project manager help with this situation?

choices.text: Maintain a laissez-faire leadership style with the team, but use a transactional style to give firm guidance to the graduate.
Ask the mentor to use a collaborative servant leader approach to perform the usual duties along with the mentor role.
Cancel the mentor plan and focus on keeping the graduate motivated by learning through an intensive immersion.
Ask three more team members to share the mentor role in order to reduce the individual mentor workload by 75%.

test.text: Some team members assigned to a new technology project expressed their lack of knowledge about the technology and the challenges they will face during implementation. What should the project manager do?

choices.text: Due to the project due dates, replace the members with more knowledgeable staff.

choices.text: Hold a kick-off meeting with all stakeholders.
Create a stakeholder register and communication plan.
Identify the stakeholders' needs and expectations.
Document the stakeholders' concerns and risks.

test.text: A project team is arranging user testing to be completed for a project but does not have a strong enough server to do so. The team orders a new server and postpones user testing.nnWhat should the project manager do moving forward?

choices.text: Eliminate the user testing from the project plan.
Utilize the current server to complete user testing.
Request to expedite the new server from the supplier.
Await the arrival of the new server and reevaluate timelines for user testing.

test.text: The team and product owner are reviewing user stories in the iteration planning meeting. While reviewing stories, it is identified that some of the high-value stories have more associated risks.nnWhat should the agile project manager do?

choices.text: Recommend that the team include risky stories in early iterations rather than later ones.
Recommend that the team choose stories with low risk for easy completion to keep team motivation high.
Work with the product owner to decide on the stories that should go during the iteration.
Use the Pareto analysis to decide which stories can be completed the fastest.

test.text: A project manager sends out requests for regular status meetings and daily standup meetings during the project setup phase. However, business stakeholders are declining the meetings.nnWhat should the project manager do?

choices.text: Check why meetings are declined
Re-share communications plan
Set up a project team ground rules
Hold a project kick-off meeting

test.text: A research and development department is planning to develop a product that will introduce a new line of business for the organization. What should the project manager do to increase the project's chances of success?

choices.text: Start developing the project management plan based on a previous project template from the project management office (PMO).
Conduct an impact analysis of the new initiative to determine how the project should be rolled out.
Plan a working session focusing on the scope, vision, and mission of the initiative.
Conduct benchmarking to determine the business viability of the initiative.

test.text: Since the beginning of a project, the product owner keeps asking during ceremonies about the budget spent for each product iteration. The product owner seems much more interested in the cost rather than the product itself.nnWhat should the project manager have done earlier to change the product owner's behavior?

choices.text: Worked on different approaches of estimating to give confidence of the cost spent in each product increment
Worked on a communications management plan with reports of budget spent in each iteration versus planned to avoid these discussions during ceremonies
Worked with the product owner to clarify their role in an agile project and the scope of the agile ceremonies
Worked on a fixed-price contract to switch the product owner's attention to value instead of money

test.text: What can a project manager do to communicate the formal project announcement and relevant information to stakeholders, and then gain their commitment?

choices.text: Create the project charter.
Conduct a kick-off meeting.
Develop the communications management plan.
Prepare and distribute the responsible, accountable, consult, and inform (RACI) matrix.

test.text: While preparing a project's third progress report, the project manager identifies that the project will experience delays due to late material deliveries. The two previous project reports indicated that the project was on track.nnWhat should the project manager do next?

choices.text: Discuss it with the project team to determine the most appropriate way to respond.
Add it to the issue log and include it in the project report.
Contact the procurement manager to expedite delivery of the material.
Escalate the issue to the project owner and request a schedule change.

test.text: An organization is under a business transformation. The project manager has been assigned to a project related to one of the new business lines.nnWhat should the project manager and team do before defining the scope of the project?

choices.text: Lead a procurement meeting.
Create a work breakdown structure (WBS).
Adapt and tailor existing assets.
Sign off on the business case.

test.text: A company outsources the execution of a project with a fixed-price contract to a supplier. During execution, the supplier agrees to deliver additional customer requirements that were not included in the contract. To fulfill the expanded scope, both parties add more resources to keep the project on the planned schedule.nnWhich technique is being applied in this project?

choices.text: Fast tracking
Crashing
Resource leveling
Lead and lag

test.text: A project manager is developing a project management plan to submit to the project sponsor in two weeks. The project sponsor, however, wants to review the early resource estimates before the deadline.nnWhat should the project manager do?

choices.text: Ask the sponsor to wait until the Work breakdown structure (WBS) is done.
Share a draft copy of the Budget Estimate Sheet (BES) with the sponsor.
Re-share the Statement of Work (SOW) with the sponsor.
Share a draft copy of the Resource Breakdown Structure (RBS) with the sponsor.

test.text: A customer requested a change to a functionality that is being delivered in the next iteration. The specialist responsible for this functionality was recently assigned to another project.nnWhat should the project manager do first?

choices.text: Request a new resource from HR.
Request a new resource from the project sponsor.
Negotiate for the resource's availability.
Tell the customer that the new change is not possible.

test.text: A project manager has just started building the team for a huge and complex project. The project manager is highly interested in having effective communication with their large team.nnWhat should the manager do to achieve this?

choices.text: Organize team activities to help team members express their interests.
Establish a process of sharing information with all team members.
Use timely and clear assessment of the situation with team members.
Allow free exchange of ideas and opinions between team members.

test.text: After completing the stakeholder analysis, the project manager is in the action planning phase. What should the project manager do with the stakeholders that have no interest or influence in the project?

choices.text: Closely monitor these stakeholders
Highly encourage these stakeholders
Attentively focus on these stakeholders
Visibly harness these stakeholders

test.text: A vendor informs a project manager that the project's equipment can be delivered earlier than anticipated. The project manager recognizes that this is an opportunity to complete the project ahead of schedule.nnWhat should the project manager do next?

choices.text: Request management approval.
Use the equipment offered.
Revise the project schedule.
Determine if there is a risk.

test.text: A supplier reports that they are over capacity, which may delay their delivery. What should the project manager update?

choices.text: Risk register
Stakeholder register
Issue log
Project schedule

test.text: A large risk to a project is identified, and the risk management plan is executed. Upon completion of the approved actions, what should the project manager do?

choices.text: Update the risk management plan.
Revise the project schedule and the budget.
Update the lessons learned.
Identify new risks, and monitor residual risks.

test.text: A project's outcome is highly sensitive to and dependent upon financial market activity. Therefore, the company's financial advisor delivers daily exchange-rate forecasts. The project's budget was planned using a conservative scenario with high exchange-rate variations. The project manager now wants to review this budget to update the probability and impact of a possible new scenario using current financial conditions.nnTo what should the project manager refer?

choices.text: Stakeholder register
Risk register
Lessons learned
Marketplace conditions

test.text: Which is the process that the project manager performs to prioritize individual project risks for further analysis or action by assessing their probability of occurrence and impact, as well as other characteristics?

choices.text: Quantitative Risk Analysis
Qualitative Risk Analysis
Identify Risks
Plan Risk Management

test.text: A project manager has finished a qualitative risk analysis with their team. Which project documents may require updating based on this information?

choices.text: Risk Register, Risk Report, Lessons Learned
Plan Risk Management, Assumption Log
Risk Register, Assumption Log, Issue Log, Risk Report
Risk Register, Risk Report

test.text: A supplier for a regulatory project is responsible for making the component changes. The supplier is unlikely to meet the project schedule. Based on the risk response plan, the project manager secured stakeholder approval to use paper forms until the component changes go live. It is still possible, however, that the paper form changes may not be ready in time.nnWhich risk type is the project manager facing in this situation?

choices.text: Secondary risk
Residual risk
Primary risk
Compliance risk

test.text: A project team often asks questions about the rationale for their work and how the client perceives their progress and deliverables. What should the project manager do to build trust and get the team engaged?

choices.text: Share feedback and invite team members to status meetings with the stakeholders.
Assure the team that the client is happy and you are handling the expectations.
Present the project plan and progress report to the team with regular updates when revised
Compare the pending tasks to the completed tasks so the team has a sense of accomplishment.

test.text: The project manager is having difficulties persuading stakeholders to adopt new technlogy in the project.n	What should the project manager have done to avoid this resistance?

choices.text: Invest in stakeholders' communication
Provide technical support to stakeholders
Propose an agreement to stakeholders
Engage stakeholders as early as possible

test.text: In a hybrid project, the project manager receives a notification that, in response to a recent court decision, a new project requirement must be incorporated into the project scope. What should the project manager do?

choices.text: Accept the new requirement as part of the project scope.
Exclude the new requirement from the project scope.
Submit a change request to the change control board (CCB).
Incorporate the new requirement after meeting with stakeholders.

test.text: A project manager is working on a critical project for which historical data is unavailable. This may put the project at risk.nnWhat should the project manager do?

choices.text: Plan project execution based on stakeholders' risk appetites.
Develop the project management plan to identify and prioritize opportunities and threats.
Inform the sponsor of the risk involved, then continue with project delivery.
Develop a risk management plan and inform key stakeholders about the risks involved.
